title: South Live: Thursday 8 March - BBC News
summary: dorset health committee chair called on to step down .
two crashes caused long delays on a34
international women 's day celebrated across the south .

documents.title: good evening
text: that 's all for bbc south live for today .
the service will resume on friday at 08:00 .

documents.title: banbury mp on bbc south today about horton review
text: banbury mp victoria prentis , who has campaigned against maternity service changes at horton general hospital in oxfordshire , will be talking on bbc south today tonight about the findings of an independent panel into the decision .
behind the scenes doing an interview for @ twitterid on the # horton and irp report .

documents.title: appeal after attempted arson in southampton
text: hampshire constabulary is investigating an attempted arson in derby road , southampton , some time between 23:30 on tuesday and 05:30 gmt on wednesday .
it left burn marks on the windows and the wall of the property .
the fire did not take hold and those inside were not aware of anything until they saw the damage in the morning .
det con keith evans said : we know that this will cause concern for residents but our neighbourhood officers will be carrying out extra patrols in the area to offer reassurance . ''

text: ascot bans bardot tops in new style guide

documents.title: steve mcclaren says oxford united have not contacted him
text: former england manager steve mcclaren has distanced himself from reports linking him to the oxford united job .
mcclaren is out of work and is reported to be in the frame for the vacant manager 's position at the league one club .
united , who were taken over by thai businessman sumrith thanakarnjanasuth last week , are still looking for pep clotet 's replacement , almost six weeks after firing the spaniard .
mcclaren told sky sports news : `` i do n't know where that 's come from , maybe because of my links there .
`` but i have had no contact from the new owner so i do n't know where the rumour or speculation is coming from . ''

documents.title: oxfordshire and berkshire apply for licences to kill badgers
text: nine areas have come forward to be considered for licences to cull badgers in a bid to curb bovine tb .
natural england , which issues the licences , said applications and expressions of interest had come from areas of `` high risk '' or those nearby .
the locations are in avon , berkshire , derbyshire , hampshire , oxfordshire , shropshire , staffordshire , warwickshire and wiltshire .
almost 20,000 badgers were culled in eight english counties last year .
in 2017 the cull took place in 19 areas in gloucestershire , somerset , dorset , cornwall , devon , herefordshire , cheshire and wiltshire .

documents.title: weekend rail disruption to hit services
text: engineering work is to affect some south western railway services this weekend .
lines between southampton central and bournemouth will be closed all day on sunday and services wo n't run between petersfield and havant either .
south western railway says it will be running bus replacement services instead .
this weekend , saturday 10 and sunday 11 march , @ twitterid engineering works may affect your journey .
for more information please see -

well what you do i 'd click the link

text: woman jailed for strangling ex-gurkha

documents.title: health bosses respond to horton report
text: health bosses have responded to advice from an independent panel on the decision to downgrade a maternity unit at an nhs hospital in banbury .
the independent reconfiguration panel ( irp ) - which was asked to look at the move by health secretary jeremy hunt - said alternatives need to be reviewed again .
it also said oxfordshire clinical commissioning group `` fell short '' in its consideration of options prior to the decision in august 2017 .
in response , occg said it had received the advice from the irp .
its chief executive , louise patten , said she would ensure it approached the recommendations in a way which ensures `` all stakeholders feel involved and informed '' .

documents.title: woman attacked near kassam stadium
text: a woman in her 20s was assaulted twice by a man near the kassam stadium in oxford , police said .
it happened on sunday between 18:30 and 19:00 gmt on knights road where the offender and victim , who are known to each other , were arguing at a bus stop .
the woman was assaulted once at the bus stop and again by the steps to the stadium car park .
both parties then left the scene in the direction of the holiday inn .
the offender is black , 5ft 11ins tall , of stocky build , and was wearing black nike tracksuit bottoms , a black nike puffer jacket , a black do-rag headscarf and was holding a bag .
a 31-year-old man from oxford has been arrested and released under investigation .

documents.title: hmv store in southampton to close
text: hmv store set to close after 24 years
very sad to hear this news spent many a saturday afternoon browsing the aisles with my husband through the years
was in there today and staff said they were 90 % certain they were just relocating
soon the only shops in town will be clothe shops and mobile .
sad time but this was predicted years ago when online shopping first started .
looks like it 's happening .
just speeding up lately

documents.title: sea life centre sees 35 % of animals die
text: sea life centre sees 35 % of animals die

documents.title: call for maternity unit downgrade review
text: alternatives to permanently downgrading a maternity unit at an nhs hospital need to be reviewed again , an independent panel has said .
it was asked to examine the decision to change the service at horton general hospital to a midwife-led unit by the health secretary jeremy hunt .
its report said oxfordshire clinical commissioning group ( occg ) `` fell short '' in its consideration of options prior to the decision in august 2017 .
the bbc has asked occg to comment .
a department for health and social care spokesperson said the independent reconfiguration panel 's advice has been received by the health secretary who will now consider its opinion .

documents.title: man wanted after £ 38,000 southampton rolex fraud
text: hampshire constabulary is looking for 31-year-old noel ward after a woman in her 70s was defrauded out of £ 38,000 in the southampton area .
on 23 october last year the lady was told to buy expensive rolex watches as payment for gardening work , which was not actually carried out .
the woman was then asked to buy more watches worth £ 71,000 , but police were alerted by the bank when she tried to transfer the money into her current account .
mr ward also has links to wiltshire , dorset , surrey , and essex .

documents.title: badger cull may expand to nine new areas
text: badger cull may expand to nine new areas

documents.title: cctv released after saxophones stolen
text: cctv has been released after two saxophones were stolen from hayes music shop , in empress road , southampton .
the instruments were taken from the store between 12:35 and 12:55 gmt on 3 march .
one of the saxophones is a selmar sa-80 , worth around £ 2,700 and the other is a yanagisawa s901 , valued at £ 2,485 .
officers investigating the theft would like to speak to the two people featured in the cctv image .

documents.title: sea life centre animal death rates 'disturbing '
text: a third of marine animals at a sea life centre died in the space of a year , figures obtained by the bbc reveal .
the marine conservation society ( mcs ) said it was reviewing its sponsorship deal with sea life amid `` particularly disturbing '' death rates .
sea life owner merlin entertainments , which is based in poole , said it did everything in its power to avoid mortalities .
it said some losses at its great yarmouth centre in 2016 were due to a `` technically complex '' water problem .
merlin also said that different aquariums could not be compared `` like for like '' , because of the different natural life spans and different ages of the animals .
author: Julian Sturdy
BBC News

documents.title: crashes cleared from a34
text: lanes have reopened after two separate crashes caused long delays on the a34 northbound this morning .
both collisions happened between east ilsley and west ilsley .
at about 10:00 gmt highways england said the collisions had been cleared by thames valley police .
traffic in the area has since returned to normal .

documents.title: nhs tracker : check key targets in your area
text: nhs tracker : check key targets in your area

documents.title: fears over kidney transplants with 126 on waiting list
text: the nhs is warning kidney donation rates are falling .
nhs blood and transplant says 126 people are waiting for a transplant in hampshire and 48 have died whilst waiting for a kidney in the past five years .
lisa burnapp , of nhs blood and transplant , said : `` living donation has been a major success story for the uk , with 1 in 3 patients receiving a kidney transplant from a living donor .
`` the decline in hampshire and around the uk is worrying , '' she added .

documents.title: renewed appeal for missing man
text: police have again appealed for help to find a 67-year-old man who has been missing since sunday .
gerald turner was last seen at his home in church hill , swanage , at about 03:00 gmt .
hm coastguard , dorset search and rescue , police and dorset & wiltshire fire and rescue have been searching for him .
officers have asked members of the public to check cctv cameras or dashcam footage for possible sightings of gerald on sunday morning .
they would also like local residents to check gardens and outbuildings in case he 's sheltering inside .
ch insp bryan duffy , of dorset police , appealed directly to mr tuner as well , asking him to contact the force or his family .
`` we all want to ensure that you are safe and well '' , he said .

documents.title: a34 delays continue
text: two separate crashes on the a34 between northbound continue to cause long tailbacks .
six vehicles were involved in the collisions between east ilsley and west ilsley .
traffic is queuing back from before junction 13 .
still delays of 60mins on # a34 northbound : two separate collisions between east and west ilsley at gore hill .

hi annabel , no , southbound is coping fine by the looks of things .

documents.title: cherries midfielder could play for england
text: bournemouth midfielder lewis cook has a `` great chance '' of playing for england `` very soon '' says manager eddie howe .
cook , 21 , has made 21 premier league appearances this season , playing in wins over arsenal and chelsea in 2018 .
`` he 's going the right way to earn that full recognition from his country , '' howe told bbc radio solent .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: radio oxford marks international women 's day
text: radio oxford has marked international women 's day by handing over the reigns of its breakfast show to philippa bilton .
she is a descendent of suffragette emily wilding davison , who died in june 1913 when she ran out in front of the king 's horse during the epsom derby .
some call her death a deliberate suicide , which succeeded in drawing global attention to the cause of votes for women .
others say she was trying to disrupt the race , but not to die .
ms bilton says gender inequality has come back into the spotlight in the past five years : `` these women 's issues and the hashtag # metoo are now mainstream it 's not going to go away ''
author: BBC Radio Oxford

documents.title: flooding closes school in wokingham
text: bohunt school in wokingham is closed due to a `` serious flooding incident '' .
it says it 's working to get the fault fixed and will open it as soon as possible .

documents.title: delays on a34 northbound
text: two separate crashes are causing long tailbacks on the a34 near east ilsley .
highways england says traffic is currently being held and delays of about one hour and 25 minutes have been reported .
both collisions happened between the m4 and a4185 and thames valley police is on the scene .

documents.title: a303 partially blocked eastbound
text: traffic is queuing on the a303 eastbound to a crash between the a3057 and old micheldever road .
the route is partially blocked with delays of about 15 minutes reported .
travel : a303 :

documents.title: call for health committee chair to resign
text: the chair of a committee scrutinising health services in dorset has been called upon to resign .
cllr ros kayes says the body led by cllr bill pipe `` is not fit for purpose '' .
she thinks it should have referred controversial plans to reorganise health services in dorset - which include the closure of poole 's a & e department - to the health secretary .
in november , cllr bill pipes said he would , but at later meetings he abstained from voting and then voted against such a move .
the plans are set to be challenged in the high court after local pressure group defend dorset nhs was granted a full hearing .

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to south live on thursday 8 march .
over the course of the day we will be bringing you the news , sports headlines , and travel updates from across the region until 18:00 .
you can get in touch with us using our oxford , hampshire , dorset and berkshire facebook pages or via our twitter accounts : @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid
